input.prompt: Look for any mentions of cache, caching, or cache management in Claude Code settings.

content.content:
After carefully reviewing the document, I found one relevant setting related to cache management:

`cleanupPeriodDays`: This setting controls "How long to locally retain chat transcripts based on last activity date (default: 30 days)". This appears to be the only explicit cache-related configuration mentioned in the Claude Code settings documentation.

toolUseResult.result:
After carefully reviewing the document, I found one relevant setting related to cache management:

`cleanupPeriodDays`: This setting controls "How long to locally retain chat transcripts based on last activity date (default: 30 days)". This appears to be the only explicit cache-related configuration mentioned in the Claude Code settings documentation.

content.text:
Based on the documentation, Claude Code has limited caching functionality:

**What gets cached:**
- Chat transcripts are locally retained based on the `cleanupPeriodDays` setting (default: 30 days)

**Cache management:**
- You can adjust how long chat transcripts are kept by modifying the `cleanupPeriodDays` setting in your Claude Code configuration
- Transcripts are automatically cleaned up based on their last activity date

The documentation doesn't mention other types of caching mechanisms like file content caching, tool result caching, or temporary storage beyond chat transcript retention.

input.prompt: Look for any mentions of transcripts, conversation history, or session data that might explain what constitutes a transcript.

content.content:
Based on the content, here are the key details about conversation history and transcripts:

Conversation history is stored locally on the user's machine. The Claude Code tool provides two ways to resume previous conversations:

1. `--continue`: Automatically continues the most recent conversation
2. `--resume`: Displays an interactive conversation picker

When resuming a conversation, the entire message history is restored, including:
- Full message context
- Tool usage and results
- Original model and configuration

A quote describing the process: "All conversations are automatically saved locally with their full message history."

The conversation picker shows details like:
- Conversation start time
- Initial prompt or summary
- Message count

Based on the content, here are the key details about conversation history and transcripts:

Conversation history is stored locally on the user's machine. The Claude Code tool provides two ways to resume previous conversations:

1. `--continue`: Automatically continues the most recent conversation
2. `--resume`: Displays an interactive conversation picker

When resuming a conversation, the entire message history is restored, including:
- Full message context
- Tool usage and results
- Original model and configuration

A quote describing the process: "All conversations are automatically saved locally with their full message history."

content.text:
A transcript in Claude Code constitutes:

**Full conversation history including:**
- All messages exchanged between you and Claude
- Tool usage and their results 
- Original model and configuration settings
- Message context and history

**Storage and management:**
- Transcripts are automatically saved locally on your machine
- They're retained for 30 days by default (configurable via `cleanupPeriodDays`)
- You can resume any previous conversation with `--continue` or `--resume`
- The conversation picker shows start time, initial prompt, and message count for each transcript

Each transcript represents a complete conversation session that can be fully restored with all context intact.

input.query: Claude Code pricing cache context tokens anthropic 2025

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Claude Code pricing cache context tokens anthropic 2025"

Links: [{"title":"Pricing - Anthropic","url":"https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/about-claude/pricing"},{"title":"Pricing \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/pricing"},{"title":"Claude Code: Deep coding at terminal velocity \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/claude-code"},{"title":"Claude Opus 4.1 \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/claude/opus"},{"title":"Claude Sonnet 4 now supports 1M tokens of context \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/news/1m-context"},{"title":"Manage costs effectively - Anthropic","url":"https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code/costs"},{"title":"Anthropic unveils new rate limits to curb Claude Code power users | TechCrunch","url":"https://techcrunch.com/2025/07/28/anthropic-unveils-new-rate-limits-to-curb-claude-code-power-users/"},{"title":"Introducing Claude 4 \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-4"},{"title":"Claude Sonnet 4 \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/claude/sonnet"},{"title":"Prompt caching with Claude \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/news/prompt-caching"}]

Based on the search results, here's information about Claude Code pricing, cache tokens, and context tokens for Anthropic in 2025:

## Claude Code Pricing (2025)

Claude Code consumes API tokens at standard Anthropic API pricing when used with an Anthropic Console account. There are two ways to access Claude Code:

1. **Subscription Plans**: Claude Code is included in Claude Max plans, with "even more Claude Code" for power users
2. **Pay-as-you-go**: Standard Anthropic API pricing applies

## Cache Context Token Pricing

Cache read tokens are 0.1 times the base input tokens price. More specifically:

- **Cache Creation**: Writing to the cache costs 25% more than the base input token price
- **Cache Usage**: Using cached content costs only 10% of the base input token price
- **Cost Savings**: Prompt caching can reduce costs by up to 90% and latency by up to 85% for long prompts

## Model Pricing (2025)

**Claude Opus 4.1**:
- $15 per million input tokens and $75 per million output tokens
- Up to 90% cost savings with prompt caching and 50% cost savings with batch processing

**Claude Sonnet 4**:
- $3 per million input tokens and $15 per million output tokens
- Up to 90% cost savings with prompt caching and 50% cost savings with batch processing

## Long Context Pricing

When using Claude Sonnet 4 with the 1M token context window, requests exceeding 200K input tokens are automatically charged at premium long context rates. When combined with prompt caching, users can reduce latency and costs for Claude Sonnet 4 with long context.

## Additional Cost Considerations

- Batch API and prompt caching discounts can be combined, providing significant cost savings
- For teams using Claude Code, token usage recommendations vary by organization size, with TPM per user decreasing as team size grows

content.text:
Based on the search results, here's how cache affects Claude Code pricing:

**Cache pricing:**
- **Cache reads cost 10% of normal input token price** (90% savings)
- Cache writes cost 25% more than base input token price
- Can reduce overall costs by up to 90% for repeated content

**Context usage:**
- Claude Sonnet 4 supports 1M token context window
- Requests over 200K tokens are charged at premium long context rates
- Prompt caching significantly reduces costs for long contexts

**Claude Code costs:**
- Averages ~$6 per developer per day
- Uses standard Anthropic API pricing when pay-as-you-go
- Included in Claude Max subscription plans
- Cache can provide up to 90% cost savings and 85% latency reduction

**Key benefit:** Cached content (like frequently referenced files or conversation history) is charged at only 10% of normal token rates, making long conversations and repeated file access much more cost-effective.
